popt4jlib.GA

Class IntVarArray1AlleleMutationOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GA.IntVarArray1AlleleMutationOp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MutationOpIntf

    public class IntVarArray1AlleleMutationOp
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutationOpIntf
    Class implements the "standard" mutation operator for chromosomes represented as int[] objects, of varying length.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      the operation mutates each chromosome argument (not a DGAIndividual, not a Function() arg object) and stores them in a Pair object that is returned.

    • Method Detail

      • doMutation

        public Pair doMutation(java.lang.Object chromosome1,
              java.lang.Object chromosome2,
              java.util.Hashtable params)
                throws OptimizerException
        the operation mutates each chromosome argument (not a DGAIndividual, not a Function() arg object) and stores them in a Pair object that is returned. Notice that the two chromosome arguments ARE actually changed as a result of this call (NO new int[]'s are created). The mutations occur according to Gaussian processes but obey the range of values specified in params.
        Specified by:
        doMutation in interface MutationOpIntf
        Parameters:
        chromosome1 - Object int[]
        chromosome2 - Object int[]
        params - Hashtable must contain the following:
        • <"dga.minallelevalue", $integer_value$> optional, the minimum value for any allele in the chromosome. Default -Infinity.
        • <"dga.minallelevalue$i$", $integer_value$> optional, the minimum value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}. If this value is less than the global value specified by the "dga.minallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • <"dga.maxallelevalue", $integer_value$> optional, the maximum value for any allele in the chromosome. Default +Infinity.
        • <"dga.maxallelevalue$i$", $integer_value$> optional, the maximum value for the i-th allele in the chromosome ($i$ must be in the range {0,...,chromosome_length-1}. If this value is greater than the global value specified by the "dga.maxallelevalue" key, it is ignored.
        • <"thread.id",$integer_value"> mandatory, the (internal) id of the thread invoking this method; this number is used so as to look-up the right random-number generator associated with the current thread.
        Returns:
        Pair containing the two int[] arguments: chromosome1 and chromosome2
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if any of the above params is incorrectly set
